results.title: Flight of the navigator
results.creator_credit: PSO, Viking Film, New Star Entertainment, Robby Wald, Dimitri Villard and Randal Kleiser
results.brief_description: A 12 year old boy is mysteriously abducted by an alien ship and returns to earth eight years later, still only 12. He now possesses great navigational powers that enable him to fly his spaceship anywhere he desires. Along with the robotic commander Max and mascot Puckmarin, David encounters an adventure of extraterrestrial proportions. Based on the story by Mark H. Baxter. Cast includes Joey Cramer, Sarah Jessica Parker, Veronica Cartwright, Cliff de Young, Matt Adler, Howard Hesseman.

results.title: Flight of the doves
results.brief_description: Constantly bullied by their cruel stepfather, Finn Dove and his young sister Derval decide to run away and find their grandmother in Ireland. They are chased by their wicked Uncle Hawk, a master of disguise, who is aware that the children are heirs to a fortune. Features Ron Moody, Jack Wild and Helen Rayne. Based on the book by Walter Macken.

results.title: Flawless
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Joel Schumacher and Jane Rosenthal
results.brief_description: Gruff, homophobic, retired security guard Walt Koontz (Robert De Niro) has, what he considers to be, the unlucky fortune of living opposite flamboyant drag queen Rusty Zimmerman (Philip Seymour Hoffman). However, after suffering a debilitating stroke in a fatality involving Rusty’s friend Amber, a tenuous link is formed between them. On advice from his physical therapist Walt asks Rusty for singing lessons to improve his speech - the constant taunting between them also helps the vocal chords. They slowly become involved in one another’s personal lives, if only playing out who faces the worst adversity and trotting off predictable homophobic and heterophobic comments. The subplot involving the retrieval of the stolen money that Amber lost her life for provides the film’s climax which is littered throughout with the usual tenets one expects from Joel Schumacher (slow-mo, image distortion), with a passing nod to “As good as it gets” in its intolerable male come good scenario, and a touch of humour. Cast also includes: Barry Miller, Daphne Rubin-Vega, Wanda de Jesus.

results.title: Flatliners
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Stonebridge Entertainment, Michael Douglas, Rick Bieber and Joel Schumacher
results.brief_description: A group of medical students are determined to experience the afterlife by putting themselves in a near-death state and reviving themselves at the last minute. To literally “flatline”, shut down their hearts, just for a short time, to experience what it would be like to die. Problems arise when one of the students, Nelson Wright (Kiefer Sutherland), becomes obsessed with death and is determined to experience the afterlife before being revived. The screenplay was written by Peter Filardi who wrote the plot after hearing of a friend’s own near-death experience during an operation. ‘Flatliners’ was one of the most popular films of the early 90’s and was the first dramatic lead role for Julia Roberts. Cast also includes Kevin Bacon, Oliver Platt and William Baldwin.

results.title: Flaming star
results.creator_credit: Don Siegel, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and David Weisbart
results.brief_description: Considered one of Elvis Presley’s most dramatic roles, “Flaming Star” is a story about Pacer Burton’s (Presley) struggle as a young man torn between two cultures. Set some years after the Civil War, the small community that Pacer lives in finds itself under siege from the Kiowa tribe. After several settlers are killed the community turns on Pacer and his family and Pacer is forced to choose between the community he grew up in and his Native American roots. His choice leads to tragedy for both sides. “Flaming Star” enables Presley to showcase his acting ability without the usual musical intermissions. Cast also includes Dolores Del Rio, John McIntire and Barbara Eden. Features the original theatrical trailer.

results.title: Five minutes to live = Door-to-door maniac
results.creator_credit: Flower Films, James Ellsworth and Bill Karn
results.brief_description: Country singer icon Johnny Cash made a rare film appearance in this 1960s thriller playing a brutal New Jersey gangster, named Johnny. When his cohort Fred devises a plan to keep the wife of a bank vice-president hostage for ransom, Johnny proceeds to terrorise her with taunts and threats. Unbeknownst to the robbers, the marriage is in a fragile state, with the husband planning to leave that very evening. As well as being an effective crime drama, “Five minutes to live” also satirises the banality of suburban life and the middle-class American lifestyle. Also stars Merle Travis.

results.title: Five easy pieces [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, BBS Productions, Bob Rafelson and Richard Wechsler
results.brief_description: In this complex, episodic drama, Bobby (Jack Nicholson). a brilliant classical pianist who makes a living working as an oil rigger, is summoned to the deathbed of his dying father. The events that transpire during his reluctant return home lead him to question his identity. Director Bob Rafelson and screenwriter Adrien Joyce (aka Carole Eastman) used the creative control afforded by the film’s low budget to craft a European-influenced character study, catching a cultural mood of anomie and resentment as it was embodied in Bobby. Neither older generation nor hippie, Bobby fits in nowhere, and his desire for independence conflicts with his emotional emptiness. Nicholson’s performance of simmering frustration resonated with 1970 audiences caught between Nixon’s silent majority and the troubled counterculture. Offering no easy answers to Bobby’s existential crisis, “Five easy pieces” is one of the pre-eminent films in the early 1970s cycle of alienated American art movies, as even the fantasy of rebellion is reduced to merely running away. Also stars Karen Black.

results.title: Fitzcarraldo
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog Filmproduktion, Werner Herzog and Lucki Stipetic
results.brief_description: An intense and enthralling portrait of an intrepid and obsessed impresario with a desire to bring both Enrico Caruso and an opera house to the deepest jungles of South America. The highlight of the story is Fitzcarraldo’s Herculean effort to haul a 300-plus ton steamboat over the mountains, for which no trickery was used in filming the gruelling sequence. Director Werner Herzog boldly embarked on the same journey, proving to be as driven and single-purposed as his protagonist, the audience’s knowledge of this adding to the excitement. In German with English subtitles. Cast includes Klaus Kinski, Claudia Cardinale, Jose Lewgoy, Miguel Angel Fuentes and Paul Hittscher.

results.title: Fists in the pocket = I pugni in tasca
results.creator_credit: Doria Film, Enzo Doria and Marco Bellocchio
results.brief_description: This bizarre drama chronicles the strange activities of a blind widow living with her four children - Augusto, Sandro, Leone and Giulia. The burden of supporting the family falls on Augusto, the only one of the four not afflicted with epilepsy. When Sandro determines to help Augusto break away and marry his girlfriend, he can see only one way to do it; and sets out to kill the rest of his family. Accompanied by a powerful film score by Ennio Morricone. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Fire over England
results.creator_credit: London Film Productions, Pendennis, Erich Pommer and William K. Howard
results.brief_description: Historical drama dealing with England’s struggle against the Spanish Armada. Performances by Vivien Leigh, Laurence Olivier, Flora Robson and an early performance by James Mason. Based on the novel by A.E.W. Mason.
